title: Ordering Exercise: Sentence Structure
description: Arrange the words or phrases in the correct order to form proper sentences.

questions.question: Arrange these words to form a correct sentence:
questions.explanation: The correct sentence is: 'I went to the store yesterday.' This follows the Subject-Verb-Object-Time structure.

questions.question: Put these sentence parts in the correct order:
questions.explanation: The correct sentence is: 'We stayed inside all day because it was raining.' The main clause comes before the subordinate clause.

questions.question: Arrange these words to form a question:
questions.explanation: The correct question is: 'Where are you going?' This follows the WH-word + auxiliary verb + subject + main verb pattern.

questions.question: Put these parts in order to form a conditional sentence:
questions.explanation: The correct conditional sentence is: 'I would call you if I had your phone number.' This is a second conditional structure.

questions.question: Arrange these adjectives in the correct order before the noun:
questions.explanation: The correct order is: 'small red Japanese car.' Adjectives follow the order: size, color, origin/nationality, noun.

questions.question: Put these time expressions in chronological order:
questions.explanation: The chronological order is: yesterday (past), now (present), tomorrow (near future), next week (further future).

questions.question: Arrange these words to form a passive voice sentence:
questions.explanation: The correct passive sentence is: 'The house was built by my grandfather in 1995.' Subject + passive verb + agent + time.

questions.question: Put these phrases in order to form a complex sentence:
questions.explanation: The correct sentence is: 'After graduating from university, she decided to study abroad to improve her career prospects.' Time clause + main clause + purpose.
